data.title: KIXT
data.meta_description: KIXT (channel 9) is a television station licensed to Seaboard, Robloxia, serving Seaboard and parts of the Peyton area, as an affiliate of ABC. Owned by the JD Broadcasting Properties. Studios and offices are located on Seaboard Avenue on Downtown Seaboard and its transmitter is located on...
data.text:
KIXT (channel 9) is a television station licensed to Seaboard, Robloxia, serving Seaboard and parts of the Peyton area, as an affiliate of ABC. Owned by the JD Broadcasting Properties. Studios and offices are located on Seaboard Avenue on Downtown Seaboard and its transmitter is located on Seaboard Lakes, Robloxia.

KIXT covers parts of the Peyton area where KPYA-LD's low-power signal is not reachable.

History

Early history

KIXT signed on August 8, 1952 as the second television station in Seaboard, 4 years after KSBR-TV (channel 5), took the affiliation from the station. KIXT's call signs are held after its mascot, Julian. The mascot's original owner was Henry Davis Johnson, a Seaboard native.

Sale to MediaMac Communications

On June 5, 1989, Henry Davis Johnson sold KIXT to MediaMac Communications, as he was ill from cancer. Henry Davis Johnson died at the age of 98 after two days the sale was completed on December 18, 1991.

Sale to Nexstar Broadcasting Group

On April 17, 2004, MediaMac would sell KIXT to the Nexstar Broadcasting Group for $54 million. That would made Nexstar's entrance to Robloxia. The sale was approved by the FCC and completed on September 3, 2004.

Sale to the JD Broadcasting Properties

On September 2, 2021, Nexstar decided to sell KIXT to the Robloxia Broadcasting Corporation for $81 million. Because an agreement was signed for the media company to reach between the network and the company. It was completed on September 15, at the following day, the Robloxia Broadcasting Corporation was renamed to the JD Broadcasting Properties.

Programming

Syndicated programming on KIXT includes Extra, The People's Court, 25 Words or Less, and Judge Mathis.

News operation

KIXT produces 97 hours, 31 minutes of locally produced newscast each week on KIXT alone (with 6 hours each weekday; 4 hours, 30 minutes on Saturdays; 7 hours on Sundays).

Notable current on-air staff

Josh Mueller - Morning/Noon Anchor (2009–present)

Charisma Johnson - Weekend Anchor (2019–present)

Charity McCallahan - Anchor (2013–present)

Ethan Ngyuen - Co-anchor (2016–present)

Brian Geiser - Chief Meteorologist (2011–present)

Nathan Hall - Sports Director (2017–present)

The station's digital signal is multiplexed:

Cable-only1. KSBR-TV is officially recognized by the network as its affiliate of record in Peyton.

2. RXNOVA-TV serves as a secondary NBC station in Nova Island, already served by KNVI.

3. KSBR-CD's Telemundo (10.2) and Univision (10.4) signals are rebroadcast on KSBR-TV's full-power multiplex. The station's virtual subchannel is listed under KSBR-TV's channel mapping.
